title: What is the EU really thinking about the Brexit extension and MPs messing about in Parliament?
text:
When EU leaders agreed the latest Brexit ‘deal’ with Boris Johnson at last week’s summit, they did so at breakneck speed and with some trepidation that it would - once again - all go pear-shaped in London.

Some significant member states had originally lobbied for Mr Johnson to first demonstrate a majority for the deal in Parliament before the final ‘scrubbed’ legal text was agreed, but this was dropped in favour of trying to seize the growing momentum for a deal.

But after initial optimism that Mr Johnson had the numbers to put his deal over the line, there now appears a growing risk that it will run into the Westminster sands as opposition forces line up to attach conditions to the future relationship...
description: When EU leaders agreed the latest Brexit ‘deal’ with Boris Johnson at last week’s summit, they did so at breakneck speed and with some trepidation that it would - once again - all go pear-shaped in London.
